name: createVolume
description: Creates a Volume on your Account. In order for this to complete successfully, your User must have the `add_volumes` grant. Creating a new Volume will start accruing additional charges on your account.

config_id.description:
When creating a Volume attached to a Linode, the ID of the Linode Config to include the new Volume in. This Config must belong to the Linode referenced by `linode_id`. Must _not_ be provided if `linode_id` is not sent. If a `linode_id` is sent without a `config_id`, the volume will be attached:

  * to the Linode's only config if it only has one config.
  * to the Linode's last used config, if possible.

If no config can be selected for attachment, an error will be returned.

label.description: The Volume's label, which is also used in the `filesystem_path` of the resulting volume.

linode_id.description: The Linode this volume should be attached to upon creation. If not given, the volume will be created without an attachment.

region.description: The Region to deploy this Volume in. This is only required if a linode_id is not given.

size.description: The initial size of this volume, in GB.  Be aware that volumes may only be resized up after creation.

tags.description: An array of Tags applied to this object.  Tags are for organizational purposes only.

body.description: The requested initial state of a new Volume.

$block: A Block Storage Volume associated with your Account.

$ul: **filesystem_path**: The full filesystem path for the Volume based on the Volume's label. Path is /dev/disk/by-id/scsi-0Linode_Volume_ + Volume label.
**hardware_type**: The storage type of this Volume.
**id**: The unique ID of this Volume.
**label**: The Volume's label is for display purposes only.
**linode_id**: If a Volume is attached to a specific Linode, the ID of that Linode will be displayed here.
**linode_label**: If a Volume is attached to a specific Linode, the label of that Linode will be displayed here.
**region**: The unique ID of this Region.
**status**: The current status of the volume.  Can be one of:
**tags**: An array of Tags applied to this object.  Tags are for organizational purposes only.
**updated**: When this Volume was last updated.
